page.title: 02Local History (A)
page.content: Cardross has a long history but the first most interesting information is about one of Scotland's most famous kings.In the fourteenth century Robert the Bruce lived in Cardross from 1326 to 1329, when he died.Robert first came to Cardross because he owned land there.He died of leprosy on the 7th June 1329.Unable to follow his desire to go on a crusade, in his will he asked that his heart be removed from his body and taken to the Holy Land. His body is buried in Dunfermline Abbey. His heart was eventually buried in Melrose Abbey, as the proposed crusade never reached the Holy Land.
